intro: Dypsidium, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. The plants are characterized by their rosettes of fleshy, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. Dypsidium species are typically grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and blooms. They prefer bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
